material.mattext: The AOA consists of any portion of the airport used for the ________.

feedback_material.feedback_mattext: This is not the best answer.
This is not the best answer.

material.mattext: The ________ consists of any portion of the airport used for the landing, taking off or surface maneuvering of aircraft.
The AOA consists of everything inside the Security Perimeter fence line.
The Movement Area includes ________.
Runways and taxiways are included in the ________.
Runways and taxiways are not part of the Movement Area.
Authorized vehicles may operate without clearance from the tower in specially designated Movement areas.
Specially designated Movement areas are specific portions of certain ________.
Authorized vehicles may operate without clearance from the tower ________.
You do not need clearance from Air Traffic Control to drive on the ________.

feedback_material.feedback_mattext: This is not the best answer.
This is not the best answer.
This is not the best answer

material.mattext: You always need clearance from Air Traffic Control to drive in the Non-Movement Area.
Driving in the Non-Movement Area requires ________.

response_material.response_mattext: No clearance from Air Traffic Control

material.mattext: This is a ________.
Taxiways have yellow paint markings and blue edge lights.
Taxiways have ________ paint markings and blue edge lights.
All runways have white paint markings and predominantly white edge lights.
All runways have white paint markings and predominantly ________ edge lights.
This is a ________.
To drive on the AOA, you must have a valid state driver’s license and ________.
To drive on the AOA, you only need a valid state driver’s license.
To drive ________, you must have a valid state driver’s license and an airport authority driver’s permit.

response_material.response_mattext: In the specially designated parking area

material.mattext: Blue badges with a “D” allow driving privileges in the SIDA.
________ badges with a “D” allow driving privileges in the SIDA.
Blue badges with a “D” allow driving privileges in the ________.
Yellow badges with a “D” allow driving privileges in general aviation areas only.
Yellow badges with a “D” allow driving privileges in ________.
________ badges with a “D” allow driving privileges in general aviation areas only.
Brown badges with a “D” allow driving privileges in the cargo areas only.
________ badges with a “D” allow driving privileges in the cargo areas only.
Brown badges with a “D” allow driving privileges in the ________.
Green badges with a “D” allow driving privileges in all Movement and Non-Movement areas.
________ badges with a “D” allow driving privileges in all Movement and Non-Movement areas.
Green badges with a “D” allow driving privileges in ________.

feedback_material.feedback_mattext: This is not the best answer.
This is not the best answer.
This is not the best answer.

material.mattext: Orange badges with a “D” are for ________.
________ badges with a “D” are for contract employees.
Orange badges with a “D” allow driving privileges in Non-Movement areas only.
All commercial vehicles operating within the AOA must have a company logo or ________.
________ operating within the AOA must have a company logo or airport-approved identifier.

material.mattext: Headlights and taillights only need to be illuminated at night.

response_material.response_mattext: Making sure windows and mirrors are clean

material.mattext: Inspecting the tires on your vehicle is part of a pre-start checklist.
Before operating a vehicle on the AOA, you should ________.
Are there exceptions to the rule “aircraft always have the right of way”?
Aircraft always have the right of way.
________ always have the right of way.
The speed limit is ________ miles per hour on all ramps.
The speed limit is 15 miles per hour on ________.
The speed limit is 15 miles per hour on all ramps.
No vehicles, except those servicing an aircraft, may pass under any part of an aircraft.
No vehicles, except those servicing an aircraft, may ________.

response_material.response_mattext: Go in reverse on the ramp
Pass under any portion of an aircraft

material.mattext: No vehicle may pass under any portion of an aircraft except a ________.
If you are involved in an accident within the AOA that results in damage or injury, you must ________.

response_material.response_mattext: Wait for a law enforcement officer to respond

material.mattext: Are you required to stop and render aid if you are involved in an accident on the AOA that results in damage or injury?
If you are involved in an accident within the AOA that results in damage or injury, you are not required to stop.

response_material.response_mattext: Runway identification marking at each end

material.mattext: You may drive on taxiways and runways to save time.
You may drive on ________ to save time.
A red sign with white lettering is a Mandatory Instruction sign.
A red sign with white lettering is a ________ sign.
A ________ sign with white lettering is a Mandatory Instruction sign.

These are ________ holding position markings.
This is a ________ sign.

A ________ sign has yellow inscriptions on a black background.
A Direction sign always has arrows.

This is a ________ sign.
Destination signs indicate the general direction to a location.
________ signs indicate the general direction to a location.

Taxiway Ending signs indicate that a taxiway does not continue beyond an intersection.
Taxiway Ending signs indicate that a taxiway ________ beyond an intersection.

A Movement Area Incursion is entering the Movement Area without authorization.
A Movement Area Incursion is entering the ________ without authorization.

If you commit a Runway Incursion, clear the runway immediately, then notify the control tower and the Communications Center.
If you commit a ________, clear the runway immediately, then notify the control tower and the Communications Center.
If you commit a Runway Incursion, clear the runway immediately, then notify the control tower and ________.
The Ground Control frequency at Lehigh Valley International Airport is ________.
The ________ frequency at Lehigh Valley International Airport is 121.9.
The Ground Control frequency at Lehigh Valley International Airport is 121.9.
The phonetic alphabet is used to avoid possible confusion in a radio transmission.
The ________ is used to avoid possible confusion in a radio transmission.

response_material.response_mattext: Magnetic compass heading of the runway

material.mattext: The phonetic alphabet is used to ________.

response_material.response_mattext: Avoid possible confusion in a radio transmission
